oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Sgt. Bruce Elmore to his mother
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Sgt. Bruce Elmore, Co. C, 143rd N.Y. Inf. Regt., USA to his mother. Author writes of engagements at Chattanooga in November 1863 and concludes "But we was entirely successful and next morning the stars and stripes waved over; Lookout Mountain and the Rebels had lost one of the strongest positions for defense that nature ever formed."
